alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Johnston; Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 8:09AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne, Sampson, central Cumberland and southeastern Johnston Counties through 845 AM EST... At 809 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Clinton, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Goldsboro, Clinton, Mount Olive, Walnut Creek, Harrells, Godwin, Eastover, Roseboro and Stedman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for central North Carolina.
